definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: They love to run about on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他们喜欢在海滩上跑来跑去。

sentences.english: The children build sandcastles on the beach.
Suppose I hold up a photograph of a beach with nobody on it.
sentences.chinese: 假设我拿着一张画着无人海滩的图片。

sentences.english: Ipanema Beach in Rio De Janeiro, Brazil, at night.
sentences.chinese: 巴西里约热内卢的伊帕内玛海滩的夜晚。

sentences.english: Molly was miserable after she got a bad sunburn on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 茉莉在海滩被太阳晒伤后就很惨。

sentences.english: The boat had been brought to a beach at Willoughby Spit in Norfolk, Virginia.
sentences.chinese: 这艘帆船被挂到了弗吉尼亚州诺福克的一处海滩上。

sentences.english: When we was walking on the beach, we saw many sea-shells.
sentences.chinese: 当我闪在海滩上散步时，我们看到我许多贝壳。

sentences.english: Dameisha Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Shenzhen.
sentences.chinese: 大梅沙海滩是深圳最受欢迎的海滩之一。

sentences.english: Dameisha Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Shenzhen.
sentences.chinese: 大梅沙海滩是深圳最受欢迎的海滩之一。

sentences.english: We also built sandcastles on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 我们也在海滩上堆沙堡。

sentences.english: Selfish picnickers litter the beach with food wrappers.
sentences.chinese: 自私的野餐者乱扔包装纸使海滩杂乱不堪。

sentences.english: Some of the pictures showed me on the beach without my shirt on.
sentences.chinese: 其中有些我没有穿衬衫站在海滩上的照片。

sentences.english: The torchlight swung across the little beach and out over the water, searching.
sentences.chinese: 手电筒的光在小海滩上扫过，而后照向水面搜索着。

sentences.english: I was so relaxed by my day at the beach, that I fell asleep in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光普照的海滩上，我放松得睡着了。

sentences.english: Larger 10)amphibious assault forces attack beaches head on in massed formations.
sentences.chinese: 大型的两栖作战部队以大规模编队正面进攻海滩。

sentences.english: The fineness of the skies tempt her to walk on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 晴朗的天空使她很想去海滩散步。

definition: lagoon/erroneously written 瀉湖|泻湖[xie4 hu2]
name of various places including Gold Coast (Australian city), Gold Coast (former British colony in Africa) and Costa Daurada (area on the coast of Catalonia, Spain)
